Bayesian Methods and Statistical Analysis

This document provides an overview of Bayesian methods, including Naive Bayes, Bayes classifier, maximum a posteriori, likelihood, mixture models, anomaly detection, EM algorithm, Laplace estimate, Bayesian networks, limits, derivatives, product rule, chain rule, variance, standard deviation, and covariance.

Key Concepts:

  • Naive Bayes classifier
  • Maximum a posteriori (MAP) estimation
  • Likelihood-based classification
  • Mixture models of Gaussians for anomaly detection
  • Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm
  • Derivatives and product rule in calculus
  • Variance and standard deviation in probability theory
